Rostóv's father kept a large establishment for the chase.
The weather was already growing wintry.
Morning frosts congealed an earth saturated by autumn rains.
The verdure had thickened.
The verdure's bright green stood out sharply against the brownish strips of winter rye.
The verdure's bright green stood out sharply against the pale-yellow stubble of spring buckwheat.
The wooded ravines and the copses had become golden and bright-red islands amid the green winter rye.

The only motion in the air was that of the dripping, microscopic particles of drizzling mist.

The drops fell on the freshly fallen leaves.

The earth in the kitchen garden glistened like poppy seed.
At a short distance the earth merged into the dull, moist veil of mist.
